activities.loc: Branch 3 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M James

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 9:07am
Defendant David M James appeared by zoom from Centralia Correctional, in custody.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Gukich present for Preliminary Hearing. 

Mr. James indicates that he did not receive attorney paperwork from jail until Friday, has completed, and will be put in the mail today. 

With the agreement of Parties, the Court sets over preliminary hearing to allow Mr. James to be appointed counsel. 

recess: 9:10am 
NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 11/29/22 at 8:30am via zoom
Notice of Court Order to Jefferson County Dispatch

Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on January 10, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial on January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 2:14pm 
Defendant David M James appeared by zoom from Centralia Correctional, Illinois, in custody.  Attorney Monica J. Hall appeared by zoom for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court reviews the court record.
The Court quashes the warrant. 

Mr. James indicates he will be in custody at Centralia Correctional through November of 2023.
DA Hall indicates that Mr. James has filed for prompt disposition and setting Preliminary Hearing, FSSC, and Jury Trial will assist in completing paperwork. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given, Mr. James indicates that he intends to apply for public defender representation 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint 

The Court requires a $2500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with co-defendant, Sabrina E.M. Cooper
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

The Court preserves all jurisdictional objections.
Preliminary Hearing set within 20 days at the request of Mr. James.
recess: 2:26pm  

NEXT:   (1) Preliminary Hearing on 11/1/22 at 9:00am via zoom (2)FSSC on 1/10/23 at 10:30am (3)Jury Trial on 1/17/23 at 8:30am [all scheduling within time limits]
Initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Correspondence from Illinois Department of Corrections with Interstate Agreement of Detainer attached

[ma] Cases 22CF165 & 22CM101 called at 8:42am 
Co-Defendant Sabrina E.M. Cooper not in court.  
Co-Defendant David M James not in court 
Barbara Ann Michaels appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Based on off the record discussion with ADA Michaels, the Court orders Cooper be renumbered to a CM
The State requests that a probable cause warrant be issued. Upon review of the file the Court finds probable cause and warrant body only.

Based on off the record discussion with ADA Michaels,the Court orders James to be renumbered to a CF
The State requests that a probable cause warrant be issued. Upon review of the file the Court finds probable cause and warrant body only.


recess: 8:44am
Per Judicial Rotation Order - Def's co-actor (22CF165) is assigned to Br. 3
